events.name: Suicide Bombing at Political Convention in Pakistan
events.wd_label: Suicide Bombing at Political Convention in Pakistan
events.wd_description: A suicide bomber attacked a political convention organized by the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazi (JUI-F) party in northwestern Pakistan, resulting in at least 54 deaths and over 100 injuries.
events.description: A suicide bomber attacked a political convention organized by the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-Fazi (JUI-F) party in northwestern Pakistan, resulting in at least 54 deaths and over 100 injuries.

events.name: Attack Details
events.wd_description: The suicide bombing targeted the JUI-F party members during a political convention with over 500 attendees, causing significant casualties.
events.description: The suicide bombing targeted the JUI-F party members during a political convention with over 500 attendees, causing significant casualties.

events.name: Suspected Perpetrators
events.wd_description: No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but the local branch of ISIS has previously targeted JUI-F party leaders, considering them apostates.
events.description: No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but the local branch of ISIS has previously targeted JUI-F party leaders, considering them apostates.

events.name: Reactions and Condemnations
events.wd_description: The attack was condemned by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and JUI-F party leader Maulana Fazlur, who expressed deep sorrow over the blast.
events.description: The attack was condemned by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and JUI-F party leader Maulana Fazlur, who expressed deep sorrow over the blast.

events.name: Investigation Launch
events.wd_description: An investigation into the blast has been launched, with the Prime Minister's office requesting a report from the Minister for Interior, Arabs Sanaullah, and the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government.
events.description: An investigation into the blast has been launched, with the Prime Minister's office requesting a report from the Minister for Interior, Arabs Sanaullah, and the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government.

events.name: Military Coup in Gabon
events.wd_description: Military officers in Gabon have announced the takeover from President Ali Bongo, ending the family's half-century rule over the country. The announcement has led to celebrations and reports of gunfire on the capital's streets.
events.description: Military officers in Gabon have announced the takeover from President Ali Bongo, ending the family's half-century rule over the country. The announcement has led to celebrations and reports of gunfire on the capital's streets.

events.name: Announcement on National Television
events.wd_description: Men in uniform announced the military takeover on national television, stating that they have placed President Ali Bongo under house arrest.
events.description: Men in uniform announced the military takeover on national television, stating that they have placed President Ali Bongo under house arrest.

events.name: House Arrest of President Ali Bongo
events.wd_label: House Arrest of President Ali Bongo
events.wd_description: President Ali Bongo has been placed under house arrest by the military officers who staged the coup.
events.description: President Ali Bongo has been placed under house arrest by the military officers who staged the coup.

events.name: Designation of Transition President
events.wd_description: General Brice Oligui Nguema has been designated as the president of the transition by the Committee for the Transition and Restoration of Institutions (CTRI).
events.description: General Brice Oligui Nguema has been designated as the president of the transition by the Committee for the Transition and Restoration of Institutions (CTRI).

events.name: Investigations and Arrests
events.wd_description: Investigations will be launched against President Bongo’s son, who was arrested alongside six other individuals for high treason.
events.description: Investigations will be launched against President Bongo’s son, who was arrested alongside six other individuals for high treason.

events.name: Shutdown of Institutions and Borders
events.wd_description: The junta confirmed that the election result would be voided, all borders would be shut, and all institutions in the country would be shut down.
events.description: The junta confirmed that the election result would be voided, all borders would be shut, and all institutions in the country would be shut down.

events.name: Niger Orders French Ambassador to Leave
events.wd_label: Niger Orders French Ambassador to Leave
events.wd_description: Coup leaders in Niger have ordered the French ambassador to leave the country within 48 hours, amidst worsening bilateral ties between France and Niger.
events.description: Coup leaders in Niger have ordered the French ambassador to leave the country within 48 hours, amidst worsening bilateral ties between France and Niger.

events.name: Expulsion Order
events.wd_description: The Junta confirmed that French ambassador Sylvain Itte was ordered to leave Niger within 48 hours for refusing to respond to a meeting with Niger's foreign minister.
events.description: The Junta confirmed that French ambassador Sylvain Itte was ordered to leave Niger within 48 hours for refusing to respond to a meeting with Niger's foreign minister.

events.name: France's Response
events.wd_description: France rejected the expulsion order, stating that the junta does not have the authority to make such a request and that the ambassador's approval comes solely from the legitimate elected Nigerien authorities.
events.description: France rejected the expulsion order, stating that the junta does not have the authority to make such a request and that the ambassador's approval comes solely from the legitimate elected Nigerien authorities.

events.name: Promise to Return Civilian Control
events.wd_description: The coup leader, Gen Abdourahamane Tchiani, promised to return control of the country to civilians within three years during a meeting with mediators from ECOWAS.
events.description: The coup leader, Gen Abdourahamane Tchiani, promised to return control of the country to civilians within three years during a meeting with mediators from ECOWAS.

events.name: U.S. Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) and EV Battery Recycling
events.wd_label: U.S. Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) and EV Battery Recycling
events.wd_description: A clause in the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act qualifies EV battery materials recycled in the U.S. as American-made for subsidies, prompting a surge in recycling efforts.
events.description: A clause in the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act qualifies EV battery materials recycled in the U.S. as American-made for subsidies, prompting a surge in recycling efforts.

events.name: Incentive for Recycled Battery Materials
events.wd_description: The IRA's clause encourages automakers to use U.S.-recycled battery materials by qualifying them for EV production incentives.
events.description: The IRA's clause encourages automakers to use U.S.-recycled battery materials by qualifying them for EV production incentives.

events.name: Impact on Recycling Industry
events.wd_description: The IRA has triggered a U.S. factory building boom, encouraging research into more recyclable batteries and influencing supply chain dynamics.
events.description: The IRA has triggered a U.S. factory building boom, encouraging research into more recyclable batteries and influencing supply chain dynamics.

events.name: U.S. Factory Building Boom
events.wd_description: The IRA has led to increased construction of recycling plants in the U.S., such as the New York plant by Li-Cycle and the Nevada complex by Redwood Materials.
events.description: The IRA has led to increased construction of recycling plants in the U.S., such as the New York plant by Li-Cycle and the Nevada complex by Redwood Materials.

events.name: vent: Li-Cycle New York Plant
events.wd_description: Li-Cycle is building a recycling plant in New York, supported by a $375 million U.S. government loan.
events.description: Li-Cycle is building a recycling plant in New York, supported by a $375 million U.S. government loan.

events.name: vent: Redwood Materials Nevada Complex
events.wd_description: Redwood Materials is constructing a recycling and remanufacturing complex in Nevada with a $2 billion U.S. government loan.
events.description: Redwood Materials is constructing a recycling and remanufacturing complex in Nevada with a $2 billion U.S. government loan.

events.name: Research and Development
events.wd_description: Automakers are investing in research to develop more recyclable batteries and efficient recycling processes.
events.description: Automakers are investing in research to develop more recyclable batteries and efficient recycling processes.

events.name: Supply Chain Dynamics
events.wd_description: The IRA has altered the demand equation for battery materials, encouraging the development of closed-loop supply chains.
events.description: The IRA has altered the demand equation for battery materials, encouraging the development of closed-loop supply chains.

events.name: Global Competition
events.wd_description: The U.S. efforts to recycle EV batteries are part of a broader global competition to undermine China's dominance in the field.
events.description: The U.S. efforts to recycle EV batteries are part of a broader global competition to undermine China's dominance in the field.

events.name: Chinese Dominance
events.wd_description: China currently handles the majority of EV battery recycling and is implementing tougher standards and increased research support for recyclers.
events.description: China currently handles the majority of EV battery recycling and is implementing tougher standards and increased research support for recyclers.

events.name: European Efforts
events.wd_description: European firms are planning recycling plants and focusing on mandates for minimum amounts of recycled materials in future EV batteries.
events.description: European firms are planning recycling plants and focusing on mandates for minimum amounts of recycled materials in future EV batteries.

events.name: Global EV Battery Recycling Market Growth
events.wd_label: Global EV Battery Recycling Market Growth
events.wd_description: The global market for EV battery recycling is projected to grow significantly, driven by increasing EV production and aging vehicle fleets.
events.description: The global market for EV battery recycling is projected to grow significantly, driven by increasing EV production and aging vehicle fleets.

events.name: Market Projections
events.wd_description: The EV battery recycling market is expected to grow from $11 billion in 2022 to $18 billion by 2028.
events.description: The EV battery recycling market is expected to grow from $11 billion in 2022 to $18 billion by 2028.

events.name: Technological Advancements
events.wd_description: Advances in recycling technology are improving yield rates and making recycling more efficient.
events.description: Advances in recycling technology are improving yield rates and making recycling more efficient.

events.name: Yield Improvement
events.wd_description: Technological advancements are increasing the yield rates of recycled materials from EV batteries, with targets close to 90-100%.
events.description: Technological advancements are increasing the yield rates of recycled materials from EV batteries, with targets close to 90-100%.

events.name: Local Recycling Initiatives
events.wd_description: Initiatives to keep recycling local are emerging, such as Nissan's leasing program in Japan and Nio's battery leasing model in China.
events.description: Initiatives to keep recycling local are emerging, such as Nissan's leasing program in Japan and Nio's battery leasing model in China.
